title: [K-12] E-Guest Utilization Strategies in Online Language Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic online learning platform usage skills and intermediate-level language proficiency
context.additional_context: In a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment, blended asynchronous/synchronous learning is combined with real-time language exchange and professional development opportunities via e-guest tools.

learning_goals: Learners enhance practical language application skills by interacting with e-guests in synchronous online sessions.
Learners listen to and summarize e-guests' presentations in their specialized fields, acquiring over 20 key language expressions.

Learners will write a 500-word report or presentation material related to a project theme (e.g., "sustainable urban development") utilizing at least 10 language expressions acquired from e-guest discussions. The output must achieve a ‘B+’ (over 85 points) grade in at least four of the five rubric items (topic relevance, language use, creativity, logical coherence, format).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
